result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary L Lynch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight Time.  Court grants 44 days credit if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Absolute Sobriety.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Ricardo Tapia advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:07 AM Defendant Zachary L Lynch in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record. 
Court conducts plea colloquy. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, with the repeater struck.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count 2 is Dismissed and read in.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Court orders the following:
IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  9 MONTHS in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-time.
44  Days Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:   2 YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety;  
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;

COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:57 AM Defendant Zachary L Lynch in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:20 AM Defendant Zachary L Lynch in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:08 PM Defendant Zachary L Lynch in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.   Drug testing frequency and duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

01:46 PM Defendant Zachary L Lynch in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
